messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Vampires---resp
messages.msgSnippet: the tales of vampires and shapeshifters are found all over the world. no culture on record has been known to be exempt from this. since humans have been
messages.messageBody:
the tales of vampires and shapeshifters are found all over the world.
no culture on record has been known to be exempt from this. since
humans have been writing things down there seem to be tales of
vampires and shape shifters. if i remember correctly the japanese
vampire was a shadowed woman who flew around at night drinking the
blood from children as they slept.

--
Democrats are sexy.
have you ever heard of a good piece of
elephant??

-Tom Hatfield

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Vampires---resp
messages.msgSnippet: The American expatriate in Japan Lafcadio Hearn wrote many tales of Japanese vampires and were-people. Check on his writings,  Murphy [Non-text portions of
messages.messageBody:
The American expatriate in Japan Lafcadio Hearn wrote many tales of Japanese
vampires and were-people. Check on his writings, Murphy
